page.title: 02Old Fulford
page.content: Old Fulford consisted of two parishes, Gate Fulford and Water Fulford, but the boundaries of the two are not clear. Both have their origins before the Norman Conquest though it is not clear exactly when. Both parishes centred on their manors which probably date back to late Anglo-Saxon times. Indeed the parish church of St. Oswald ( Gate Fulford ) was dedicated to Oswald the Christian king of Northumbria who was killed in battle in 642. In 1078 William I granted both of the manors to two of his loyal followers whose descendants remained for several centuries.
